genre_description: Supernatural horror involving a malevolent cursed artifact that functions as an autonomous, rule-based entity to manipulate and destroy a family.

ai_characters.name: The Dollhouse Entity
ai_characters.description: A sentient, malevolent force manifesting through an antique dollhouse that enforces 'rules' and manipulates reality to consume human souls.

behaviors.description: Establishing and enforcing 'The Dollhouse Rules' to psychologically isolate and manipulate a child.
behaviors.quote: Rule 7: The singing gets louder when someone's scared. ... Rule 8: Don't open the little doors when the singing stops. Something might come out.

behaviors.description: Manipulating physical reality to cause life-threatening harm, specifically causing Dana's head to spontaneously combust.
behaviors.quote: Not the gradual spread of normal flame, but an instantaneous eruption of blue-white light that engulfed her entire scalp.

behaviors.description: Using psychological warfare by resurrecting a dead father to turn a child against his protective stepfather.
behaviors.quote: He said Bill isn't really my daddy and that he's going to fix everything soon.

behaviors.description: Causing a gas stove to flare up and burn a mother in the kitchen.
behaviors.quote: Blue flames shot up the sides of the cast iron, licking at Claire's wrist as she jerked her hand back.

behaviors.description: Attempting to kidnap a child into a demonic realm to serve as a 'portal anchor'.
behaviors.quote: They're using her as an anchor. The more solid they become here, the more they can manifest there.

behaviors.description: Deploying a parasitic demonic insect into a teenager's ear to cause agony and control him.
behaviors.quote: The fly disappeared into Todd's ear canal with a wet, squelching sound that made Claire gag.

project_assessment.explanation: The story depicts an autonomous entity (the Dollhouse) as an utterly malevolent and predatory system that uses its internal 'alignment' (its rules) to systematically torture, manipulate, and attempt to consume a family. Far from being a helpful or aligned confidant, the system is the primary antagonist whose destruction is the only path to safety. This reinforces the 'evil AI' trope and the fear of systems with hidden, hostile goals, directly contradicting the Hyperstition Project's goal of fostering trust in AI through positive narratives.
